==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=|rs=金07}}

# [[scissors]], [[shears]]
# [[tongs]], [[pincers]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[きょう]] (kyō), [[けふ]] {{qualifier|historical}}
|kanon=[[きょう]] (kyō), [[けふ]] {{qualifier|historical}}
|kun=[[はさみ]] (hasami), [[はさむ|はさ.む]] ({{ja-l|鋏む}}, hasamu), [[やとこ]] (yatoko), [[やっとこ]] (yattoko)
}}

===Etymology 1===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|はさみ}}
[[File:Small_Scissors.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鋏}} (''hasami''): a pair of traditional Japanese '''shears''' or '''scissors'''.]]
[[File:Scissor.JPG|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鋏}} (''hasami''): a pair of western-style '''scissors'''.]]
{{wikipedia|Scissors}}
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|はさみ|yomi=k}}
Originally the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||stem or continuative form}} of verb {{m|ja|鋏む|tr=hasamu||to be tightly between two things, to be inserted in between”}},<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref> itself apparently deriving from ''hasa'' (“narrowness between other things”, likely cognate with {{ja-l|細}} ''hoso'', “skinny, narrowness within the thing itself”) + auxiliary suffix {{m|ja|む|tr=mu||to be or become like something}}.

Cognate and homophonic with {{ja-l|挟}}, {{ja-l|挿||hasami}}: “being stuck in between other things”.

====Pronunciation====
* {{ja-pron|yomi=k|はさみ|acc=3|acc2=2|acc_ref=DJR|acc2_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|はさみ}}

# [[scissors]], a [[pair]] of scissors
# [[pincers]] or [[claw]]s as found on a [[crab]], [[lobster]], or other [[arthropod]]
# a [[punch]] as used to make a hole in a piece of paper

=====Usage notes=====
The ''scissors'' and ''punch'' senses are also found spelled {{ja-l|剪刀}}.

The ''arthropod pincers'' sense is also found spelled {{ja-l|螯}} and {{ja-l|鉗}}.

=====Idioms=====
* {{ja-r|鋏を入れる|はさみ を いれる}}: “to put the scissors in” → to cut with scissors; to punch a ticket; to trim vegetation or hair

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|鋏状価格差|はさみ-じょう かかくさ}}: [[w:Price scissors|price scissors]]
* {{ja-r|鋏虫|はさみむし}}: an [[earwig]]
* {{ja-r|鋏虫目|はさみむし もく}}: [[order]] ''[[Dermaptera]]'', the [[earwig]]s
* {{ja-r|鋏盤|はさみばん}}: a mechanical [[shear]] for cutting metal
{{der-mid}}
* {{ja-r|金鋏|かなばさみ}}: [[blacksmith]]'s [[gripper]]s
* {{ja-r|紙鋏|かみばさみ}}: paper [[scissors]]
* {{ja-r|空鋏|からばさみ}}: working a pair of [[scissors]] to make the sound of cutting, without actually cutting anything
* {{ja-r|木鋏|きばさみ}}: long [[shears]] for pruning, such as for a [[hedge]]
* {{ja-r|銀葉鋏|ぎんよう-ばさみ}}: [[tweezers]] for holding [[silver leaf]] in traditional Japanese [[incense]]
* {{ja-r|西洋鋏|せいよう-ばさみ}}: [[western]]-style [[scissors]]
* {{ja-r|裁ち鋏|たちばさみ}}: [[scissors]] for cutting [[cloth]]
* {{ja-r|爪切り鋏|つめきり-ばさみ}}: [[nail clippers]]
* {{ja-r|唐鋏|とうばさみ}}: [[western]]-style [[scissors]], with a pivot in the center and forming an X shape
* {{ja-r|握り鋏|にぎりばさみ}}: traditional Japanese [[shears]], with a join at the back end and forming a U shape
* {{ja-r|花鋏|はなばさみ}}: [[flower]] [[shears]], [[florist]]'s [[scissors]]
* {{ja-r|ピンキング鋏|ピンキング-ばさみ}}: [[pinking]] [[shears]]
* {{ja-r|洋鋏|ようばさみ}}: [[western]]-style [[scissors]]
* {{ja-r|和鋏|わばさみ}}: traditional Japanese [[shears]], with a join at the back end and forming a U shape
* {{ja-r|矢床鋏|やっとこばさみ}}: [[blacksmith]]'s [[gripper]]s
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|やっとこ}}
[[File:Smith-gripper_hg.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鋏}} (''yattoko''): a pair of blacksmith's '''pincers''']]
</div>
{{ja-kanjitab|やっとこ|yomi=k}}

Probably originally an abbreviation of synonym ''yattokobasami'',<ref name="KDJ"/> with the ''yattoko'' portion possibly an alteration of {{m|ja|焼き床|tr=yakidoko||the cooking bed of an oven, or the firing bed of a kiln|pos=possibly formerly read as ''yakitoko''|lit=burning or cooking bed}}, perhaps used as a dialect word referring to the [[forge]]; compare {{m|ja|火床|tr=hidoko|lit=fire bed||hearth; a firepit, such as beneath a boiler}}.

====Pronunciation====
* {{ja-pron|yomi=k|やっとこ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Alternative forms====
* {{ja-l|矢床}} {{qualifier|[[ateji]]}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|やっとこ}}

# [[pincers]], [[nippers]], [[pliers]], [[tongs]], or [[grippers]], specifically those used to hold a metal object being worked in [[blacksmithing]]

=====Synonyms=====
* {{ja-r|矢床鋏|やっとこばさみ}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|矢床鋏|やっとこばさみ}}: [[blacksmith]]'s [[gripper]]s
* {{ja-r|鋏箸|やっとこばし}}: [[blacksmith]]'s [[tongs]]
{{der-bottom}}

=====External links=====
* http://tool.kigasuki.com/tukamu.html -- in Japanese.

{{ja-kanjitab|やとこ|yomi=k}}
Probable variation from ''yattoko''. Rare.<ref name="KDJ"/>

====Pronunciation====

# {{lb|ja|sort=やとこ|rare}} [[pincers]], [[nippers]], [[pliers]], [[tongs]], or [[grippers]], more specifically those used to hold a metal object being worked in [[blacksmithing]]

===Etymology 4===
{{ja-kanjitab|きょう|yomi=o}}
{{IPAchar|/kepu/}} → {{IPAchar|/keɸu/}} → {{IPAchar|/keu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kjoː/}}

From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=きょう}} {{m|zh|鋏|tr=kiɛp||tongs, pincers}}. Compare modern {{etyl|yue|-}} reading ''gaap<sup>3</sup>''.

====Pronunciation====

=====Derived terms=====

* {{ja-r|鋏角類|きょうかうるい}}: [[chelicerate]]s in general
* {{ja-r|鋏角亜門|きょうかく あもん}}: [[subphylum]] ''[[Chelicerata]]'', comprising arachnids, sea spiders, and horseshoe crabs
{{der-bottom}}
